sections.content: Doctors were manually routing prescriptions across 4 pharmacy partners (Crafted RX, Greenwich/Texas Performance Meds, Outreach RX, patient local pharmacy) with no systematic guidance, risking missed and duplicate prescriptions.

sections.title: The Core Issue
sections.content: The real issue wasn't just unclear routing logic‚Äîdoctors had no audit trail to track what they'd sent. Without visibility into previous routing decisions, they couldn't prevent errors or learn from patterns.
I spent two days shadowing doctors to understand their workflow. Through observation and interviews, I discovered:

content: Doctors switching between multiple pharmacy partner systems
No clear rules for which pharmacy handles which medication
Duplicate prescriptions sent to multiple pharmacies
No audit trail of routing decisions
Manual workarounds creating operational risk

sections.content: After identifying the problem, I validated the requirements with stakeholders:

content: Doctors needed clear routing guidance at prescription time
System must prevent duplicate routing
Complete audit trail for compliance and troubleshooting
Solution must integrate with existing DoseSpot e-prescribing iframe
Fast implementation‚Äîcouldn't wait months for complex automation

sections.content: Product judgment: Built manual workflow bridge above DoseSpot iframe rather than complex automation, balancing speed with reliability.

content: Fast delivery (3 weeks vs. 3 months for full automation)
Reliability (simple UI with clear guidance)
Audit trail (every routing decision tracked)
Flexibility (easy to adjust rules as pharmacy partnerships evolve)

sections.content: Holistic implementation: Wrote 12 detailed Jira tickets across 2 sprint cycles with acceptance criteria and edge cases.

sections.title: Implementation Scope
content: UI component above DoseSpot iframe with routing logic
Database schema for audit trail
Pharmacy partner selection rules engine
Admin interface for managing routing rules
Error handling and validation
Analytics and reporting dashboard

sections.content: Worked directly with doctors during pilot rollout:

content: Beta tested with 2 doctors for 1 week
Gathered feedback on UI clarity and routing logic
Adjusted pharmacy selection rules based on real usage
Verified audit trail captured all necessary data

sections.content: Full rollout to all doctors within 3 weeks of initial deployment.

sections.content: Sometimes the best technical solution isn't the most automated one. By building a simple, reliable workflow instead of complex automation, we delivered faster and achieved better outcomes. User research (shadowing doctors) was critical to understanding the real problem‚Äîno audit trail‚Äîrather than the surface problem of routing logic.
